quote: We youths say “like” all the time because we mistrust reality.
author: James S. Kunen,  The Strawberry Statement: Notes of a College Revolutionary

quote: Just tell me how to be different in a way that makes sense.
author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

quote: You don't have to be good at something to be liked.
author: Stephen Richards

quote: I liked things better when I didn't understand them.
author: Bill Watterson

quote: If you're young and talented, it's like you have wings.
author: Haruki Murakami,  What I Talk About When I Talk About Running

quote: Be like the sun for grace and mercy. Be like the night to cover others' faults. Be like running water for generosity. Be like death for rage and anger. Be like the Earth for modesty. Appear as you are. Be as you appear.
author: Rumi

quote: I like good strong words that mean something…
author: Louisa May Alcott,  Little Women

quote: I was thinking of how sometimes, trying to say the right thing to people, it's like some kind of brain surgery...
author: M.T Anderson

quote: if being is many, it must be both like and unlike, and this is impossible, for neither can the like be unlike, nor the unlike like
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: Think with your whole body.
author: Taisen Deshimaru

quote: I like my relationships like I like my eggs. Over easy.
author: Jarod Kintz,  It Occurred to Me

quote: There's some heinous fuckery goin' on mon.
author: Christopher Moore,  Fluke: Or, I Know Why the Winged Whale Sings

quote: We understand more than we know.
author: Margaret Atwood,  Oryx and Crake

quote: I always like a dog so long as he isn't spelled backward.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: Like a child, always enjoy the world.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Mean girls go far in high school. Kind women go far in LIFE.
author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass

quote: Words are, like wines.
author: Santosh Kalwar,  You Can

quote: Stuff your brain with knowledge.
author: Karl Lagerfeld

quote: We live and breathe words.
author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Prince

quote: I actually like how doctors talk. I like the sound of science. I like how words you don't understand explain things you can't understand.
author: R.J. Palacio,  Wonder

quote: I like using big words. Words like huge, gigantic, massive.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This is the story my great-grandfather told my father, who then told my grandfather, who then told me about how The Mythical Mr. Boo, Charles Manseur Fizzlebush Grissham III, better known as Mr. Fizzlebush, and Orafoura are all in fact me...

quote: Everything I need to know... I learned in kindergarten.
author: Robert Fulghum,  All I Really Need to Know I Learned in Kindergarten
تركي الدخيل,  كيف تربح المال بأقل مجهود!

quote: Try to be like the turtle - at ease in your own shell.
author: Bill Copeland

quote: I was like I was in science class: I was curious.
author: Alice Sebold,  The Lovely Bones

quote: I'm not young enough to know everything.
author: J.M. Barrie,  The Admirable Crichton

quote: when we were kidslaying around the lawnon ourbellieswe often talkedabouthowwe'd like todieandwe allagreed on thesamething;we'd alllike to diefucking(althoughnone of ushaddone anyfucking)and nowthatwe are hardlykidsany longerwe think moreabouthownot todieandalthoughwe'rereadymost ofuswouldprefer todo italoneunder thesheetsnowthatmost ofushave fuckedour livesaway.
author: Charles Bukowski,  You Get So Alone at Times That it Just Makes Sense

quote: I write to understand as much as to be understood.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: Wisely and slow; they stumble that run fast.
author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet

quote: I am not young enough to know everything.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: You can't just make me different and then leave
author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska

quote: And so it goes...
author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Slaughterhouse-Five

quote: Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way.
author: Steve Martin

quote: Write what you know.
author: Mark Twain,  The Adventures of Tom Sawyer & Adventures of Huckleberry Finn

quote: With our thoughts we make the world.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: Being liked for the way you looked is worse than not being liked at all.
author: Amanda Hocking,  My Blood Approves

quote: A little perspective, like a little humor, goes a long way.
author: Allen Klein

quote: Read a thousand books, and your words will flow like a river.
author: Lisa See,  Snow Flower and the Secret Fan

quote: End with an image and don't explain.
author: Stanley Kunitz,  The Collected Poems

quote: I go to school, but I never learn what I want to know.
author: Bill Watterson,  The Authoritative Calvin And Hobbes

quote: Puns are a form of humor with words.
author: Guillermo Cabrera Infante

quote: By thinking of things you could understand them.
author: James Joyce,  A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man

quote: Learn the rules like a pro, so you can break them like an artist.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: You like them,"I realized.Noah's eyebrows lifted in question."Like as people.""As opposed to...furniture?""They're my PARENTS.""That is my understanding, yes.
author: Michelle Hodkin,  The Evolution of Mara Dyer

quote: Go where your nose leads you
author: Patricia Griecci,  Pampered Pooch Parties: Easy Dog Recipes And Crafts To Create A Howling Good Time

quote: When people want to be liked for what they did, they should stop.
author: Karl Lagerfeld

quote: When I’m writing my own stuff, it’s like swimming upstream. Or … falling down a cliff and grabbing at branches, trying to invent the branches as I fall.
author: Rainbow Rowell,  Fangirl

quote: Words can be like X-rays if you use them properly -- they’ll go through anything. You read and you’re pierced.
author: Aldous Huxley,  Brave New World

quote: I found I could say things with color and shapes that I couldn't say any other way - things I had no words for.
author: Georgia O'Keeffe

quote: Babe!
author: Janet Evanovich
